title: Font used on an old Bulgarian stamp
content:
Hi everyone,

Can anybody help me to find the font used for "Bulgaria" ?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829175616im_/http:/typophile.com/files/4452389263_113ec1a6c3_b_4862.jpg)

Thanks in advance !

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [4452389263\_113ec1a6c3\_b.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829175616/http:/typophile.com/files/4452389263_113ec1a6c3_b.jpg) | 737.73 KB |
author: Alphonse

comments.content: Don't know it but here are some you may like: [Lubalin Graph ITC](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829175616/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/lubalin-graph) (possibly the closest in term of overall design approach, main difference being top unserifed /A), [Rockwell](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829175616/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/rockwell), [Teletex](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829175616/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/northernblock/teletex) (artificially emboldened by adding a thick outline stroke might work?), [Novocento Slab](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829175616/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/synthview/novecento-slab), [Sketch Block](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829175616/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/artill-typs/sketch-block) (keeping only outlines), [Figgins Brute](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829175616/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/figgins-brute) (very different mainly because of /R but I like its vintage feeling), [Stymie](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829175616/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/Stymie) (see Teletex), [Arvo](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829175616/http:/www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/arvo), [Rokkitt](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829175616/http:/www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/rokkitt), [Kettering](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829175616/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/Kettering) 105 and 205

Slab serif lettering perhaps inspired by Rockwell, designed by Frank Hinman Pierpoint in 1934 for Monotype as an updating of Inland's Litho Antique of 1910. Rockwell's G matches the lettering, but the leg on R has only a half serif.  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/rockwell/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829175616/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/rockwell/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/rockwell/")  
Don

There is also a Rockwell knockoff called Rokkitt. You should check whether it's legitimate before using it.  
Don
